item.author: jeffreybjohnson

item.title: Fallout Big Guns Bobblehead Minigun Alternative
item.description:
Made in Nov 2019 using the free browser-based program TinkerCAD to 3D print specifically for the real-life Fallout Big Guns Bobblehead to replace the boring minigun he holds.

I managed to measure it to even fit in Vault Boy's hands correctly, however, with the settings I had used, the forward handle broke off a few weeks after printing (and I'm pretty well over 3D-printing anything else myself until the tech gets to where it requires way less fiddly maintenance).

The scorpion shown on the back wasn't really distinguishable in the final print, by the way.

Inspired by the miniguns from Doom (2016), Deep Rock Galactic, and shadowdragon811's, here.
item.author: StygianEmperor

item.title: MTM ACR5-72 Ammo Crate Vertical Card Organizer
item.description:
This was designed to turn an MTM Case-Gard ACR5-72 Ammo Crate into a vertical card storage big. I designed it for Marvel Legendary but any standard sized cards could be stored in it with plenty of room for sleeved cards. Each file covers 1/4 of the case and can be mixed and matched and mirrored (m) to meet your storage needs.

The basic card organizer would require 2 prints of file 1 and 2 prints of file 1 mirrored.
item.author: zerohix

item.title: DnD Miniature Base
item.description:
Just some simple miniature bases to be used for DnD or other tabletop games where miniatures require bases of approximately 25mm (or 1inch) in diametre.

There are 2 different sizes

  1. 1x1 sizes are 25mm in diametre (roughly 1 tile in DnD)
  2. 2x2 sizes are 50mm in diametre (roughly 2 tiles wide in DnD)

There are 2 different versions.

  1. Mini Base 1x1 and Mini Base 2x2 are simple bases that need to have models put on top of them.
  2. Papercraft Mini Base 1x1 and Papercraft Mini Base 2x2 are bases that include a little indentation to slide paper art into as well as an indented arrow in the base to indicate the facing direction of the miniature.
item.author: cergoh

item.title: Shell 2.5 DIN vertical DIN mount
item.description: Minimalist version of the original vertical mount. I've thinned the walls and clip to remove material to reduce the filament used and speed up the print time. My Shelly 2.5 will not be visible, so did not need the fillets and Shelly logo etc.
item.author: gknapp

item.title: Anemometer V1.0
item.description:
Anemometer - Solar - Wifi - Bluetooth

BOM

1 x ESP32 like Firebeetle, or ESP WROOM Lolin32 or LOLIN32 with ESP32 240MHz Dual-Core, WiFi, Bluetooth/BLE, 4MB Flash, Charging Circuit, Arduino IDE Compatible
1 x AS5600 Absolute Encoder PWM / I2C Port Precision 12-bit (wind direction)
2 x Ky 003 Magnetic Sensor Module DC 5 V (Wind Speed)
1 x INA3221 Triple Channel Shunt Power Supply Voltage Monitor Sensor
1 x Solar panel 12W 12v 20W or more recommended especially for winter saison in the north of Europe
4 x ball bearings 624Z 4 mm x 13 mm x 5 mm Single Row
2 x M4 40mm bolt + nolt
1 x Waveshare Solar Power Management Module for 6V~24V Solar Panel
3 x magnets for the wind speed
1 x magnet for the AS5600 encoder (wind direction) se the datasheet. In my case I used the magnet of a old defective RC chopper motor diameter 5mm
2 x 18650 (2 x 2000mA/h) Aku recycled from laptop battery pack
1 old usb cable of the desired length
6 x screws for the wind speed and direction
2 x threaded rod 80mm length

item.author: amgn007

item.title: Computer fan air duct
item.description:
Air duct to connect 120 mm x 32 mm cooling fan to 3/4 inch flexible wire loom.
The fan and wire loom that I used.
Wathai 120mm x 32mm Brushless Cooling Blower Fan 12V DC Dual Ball Centrifugal Fan High Airflow https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08P1S5DBN/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1
3/4" Wire Loom Non-Slit Polyethylene Corrugated Flexible Innerduct Conduit https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01M9A35ZW/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1
Two versions one with a side port to bypass some of the air (V2) and one without side port (V1). If the door (V3) for the vent port moves too easily bend it slightly so it is tighter in the slide tracks.
I used it to supply air to an oil heater. The side vent duct is used to vary the air output. I could have done that with a rheostat.

item.title: Origins: First Builders boardgame organizer
item.description:
This is an organizer for the board game Origins: First Builders. Each item should be printed according to the filename (e.g., _x5 means print five of them).

There is a lot of space left in the box for hopeful future content. There are also large spacers to make everything a nice level for supporting the board on top.

item.author: crashingdrones

item.title: Fallout New Vegas Sign (FWW)
item.description:
I've printed this with the Fat Dragon Games profiles for Cura and it comes out very nicely, I've combined the items from the original files so you don't need to try and affix the stand to the base, added a platform for the NCR Veteran Ranger to stand on and textured the base.

I couldn't get the file for the sign to load up in blender to tweak it so I've just had to scale the sign down on Cura, these are the dimensions I've used;
X - 100mm
Y - 70mm
Z - 10mm

That looks about the right scale to me but could be tweaked to suit your eye.
item.author: Aragorn_Stark

item.title: Obsession boardgame organizer
item.description:
This is an organizer for the game Obsession, reusing all the lovely boxes it comes with. You need to print one of everything, except for 'Obsession Servants x2.stl' which should be printed twice.

Also check out my organizer for the House boxes: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4826913
item.author: jscherpelz

item.title: Mars 2 Pro Plate Holder for Washing Station
item.description:
This part is the buildplate holder that I designed to hold the buildplate from a Mars 2 Pro. it fits a Decor 3L container, and is intended to work in two positions. Position 1 holds the plate so that it's just submerged when the container is filled with 1.7L of resin cleaning solution. Position 2 supports the print job above the solution, at an angle, so that the worst of the cleaning solution will drip off the build plate.

Note: I designed this print to be printed on my FDM printer. I acknowledge that it'd be good to design one that would be printable on a resin printer, since it's an accessory for resin printers.

I just couldn't bring myself to spend hundreds on a wash & cure machine, but needed to have just a slightly better workflow for my resin prints. I settled on:

  • Decor 3L container (fits build plates for a Mars 2 Pro or similar) - $5
  • 1.7L of Apple scented ResinAway (thanks, monocure3d.com.au )
  • magnetic stirrer - Intllab, $41
  • 3D printed head holder (2 positions - cleaning, and drip-dry)
  • solar turntable - $7
  • UV box made from scrounged parts (some spare UV LEDs, foil-faced XPS from an old vending machine, 12V power supply also from a vending machine, "lid on" switch from a microwave)

I drip the print inside the printer to remove excess resin.
Next the whole build plate and print goes onto the head holder, in the "cleaning" position inside the tub, while the stirrer works its magic.
Then the build plate gets turned 90 degrees, so that it can sit at an angle on top if the tub and drip-dry.
The lid goes straight back onto the tub next, sealing it off for next time.
Then the print has supports removed and goes into the UV chamber, where the foil coating and solar turntable ensure that the UV from the array of LEDs cures it evenly.
Bit of a wash to remove any excess ResinAway, and the print is done.

It's a lot less messy, and gets a better wash and cure than my old process. Not bad for $53.

(and most of that cost was for the magnetic stirrer, which I see as a separate cost really, because magnetic stirrers are SO much fun, especially if you have young kids who like playing with a vortex)

item.author: hooten

item.title: CodeNames Pictures Organizer
item.description:
This is my second game organizer print. This model was built with silk PLA and the finish came out beautiful. I want with a very modest infill pattern and <10% density. The strength comes largely form the edges but a tighter meh gives more support for early layers of the top surfaces.

This fits snugly inside my game box and the key card stand occupies the slack space (no shuffling around inside the box). The clue card stack is very tall and you can't quite fit all of them into the clue card section in this model. You can try lowering the floor if you like but I didn't want the floor to be too thin. The few extra cards fit easily into the cover card slot. You will not be able to sleeve your cards like my Star Trek build.
item.author: DaFuzzTSU

item.title: AntLion Audio ModMic Wireless x Beyerdynamic DT 990 PRO - Headset holder
item.description:
Hello,

today I have a headset mount.
I have the beyerdynamic DT 990 PRO connected with the AntLion Audio ModMic Wireless.
A very good audio quality coupled with a good wireless microphone connection.
With magnets it is possible to disconnect it without problems. (These must only be glued in)
To date, I am very satisfied with it.

(The white edges are from the glue).

Do you have ideas for improvement? Feel free to share them with me.

Best regards

Materials you need:

  • magnets 5x1 mm
item.author: 3D-ForEach
